result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Robert Seekamp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham June 28, 2016 - Amend days credit.

-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
-Court extends 10 days sentence requests to Atty Petros with the State to have 5 days to respond.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF513.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF513.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to submit DNA sample.
-Defendant to complete any additional treatment and any follow through.
-Defendant to maintain employment and/or education.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant remanded into custody.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Steven Robert Seekamp appeared from jail. Case called at 1:00. The PSI has been completed. Atty. Petros believes there are no corrections to the PSI. ADA Minser updates the court and makes recommendations. Atty. Petros makes recommendations. DE makes statement. Court imposes:

8  years total confinement concurrent
4 years  initial confinement
4 years  extended supervision
DE IS eligible for the substance abuse program.
DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.

Conditions of extended supervison:

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and reqular testing.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Costs
- DE to complete any additional treatment and any follow through.
- DE to maintain employment and or education.

Court extends 10 days sentence requests to Atty. Petros with the State to have 5 days to respond. 
DE is remanded.
Sentencing hearing at 01-29-2016 01:00 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann DF: Steven Robert Seekamp appeared. Case called at 4:18. ADA Minser updates the court. Atty. Amann agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G  to 14CF513. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty to 14CF513. Sentencing arguments. ADA Minser questions using the risk portion of the Compass. Court will ask of the agent to only include the need portion of the assessment. Crt orders a PSI to be completed by 11-16-2015. Court vacates bond and remand DE to the St. Croix County Jail pending sentencing. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
